name: tobi oyebade
essay:
RADIO VS TV: THE ULTIMATE MEDIA SHOWDOWN
Radio and television have shaped how we consume content for decades, each with unique strengths and limitations.
RADIO BENEFITS: Radio offers unmatched portability and multitasking freedom—you can listen while driving, working, or exercising. It's cost-effective, requires no screen time, and stimulates imagination through audio storytelling. Radio creates intimate connections between hosts and listeners, fostering community engagement. Production costs are lower, making it accessible for local voices.
RADIO LIMITATIONS: Lack of visual elements limits demonstration and presentation. No playback control means you can't rewind missed segments. Advertising interruptions can disrupt flow.
TV BENEFITS: Television combines visual and audio elements for immersive storytelling. Complex information becomes easier to understand through graphics, demonstrations, and body language. On-demand streaming offers flexibility and control.
TV LIMITATIONS: Requires dedicated attention and screen access. Higher production costs limit content diversity. Screen time concerns affect health and wellbeing.
MOST ENGAGING PROGRAMME: At Glow 99.1 FM, "WINRINWINRIN" (Mondays 4-6 PM) stands out as the station's most engaging show, delivering energetic content that perfectly showcases radio's power to entertain and connect communities across Akure
